reviews.review_text: TLDR:  Grow Up  is an okay game on its own, but it strays from the simplicity and straightforwardness of the original  Grow Home  and as a result mostly fails to recapture the magic of the original.
Perfect sequel to Grow Home
Get glider ability and 40 gems as soon as you can.  Then you can enjoy  Infinite Power Glider Simulator .

Grow Up is everything that I wanted in a sequel to Grow Home.  The positives: + More collectibles + Challenges + More costumes + Huge world to explore with multiple biomes, new plants, and animals + Mobility options are built into BUD instead of being plant based (i.e. Glider and Air Break instead of Flower and Leaf) + Additional character in POD, who can help you find things on the map  The negative: - BUD can be difficult to handle in challenges as you have to be more precise with his movements during a limited amount of time  Other than the one negative, Ubisoft Reflections has made a perfect sequel to the first game and they should be very proud of their work!

I enjoyed Grow Home but replaying it after playing Grow Up the new features and updates are obvious. Grow Home is so much more aggravating than Grow Up. I'd say you should definely check out this series but there is no need to play the first game. Just skip Grow Home. On the other hand I'd recommend you all to check out Grow Up. It's bigger, better gameplay, more collectibles, and still has the Grow Home feel but on a bigger scale.

Beautiful game. The visuals, sounds, and animations are stunning. Very gentle and fun gameplay.  I like that the play area is much larger than in the previous episode.  The mid- and late-game abilities are fun, but kind of break the challenge of platforming. I wish their use was more constrained.

A great game for all ages. If you enjoy open worlds with collectibles and unlockables than this game is for you. The art style is cute and the game is relaxing to play. Its almost therapeutic. This is something you could sit and enjoy with your kids, with your spouse, with a friend, or just by yourself. Plus, for ten dollars its a steal.

This is probably one of my favorite games, as it is very entertaining and is good as a stand alone game. My problem is the inability to alter the controls in any way. If you can pilot the Glider and the Starplant with inverted w/s, I would recommend this game.

This game is a very fun and addicting 3d platformer with challenges, explording and more! This was super fun to play as i really enjoyed Grow Home. I recommend the game to anyone who is a gamer.  Positives about the game...  - You can do whatever you want, build a tower out of mushrooms, no one is gonna stop you! Fly to the moon you say? Well do that, as I said NO ONE IS STOPING YOU :D  - You can collect crystals, floraforms, budssuits. It's simply awesome.  - You can interact with objects such as, stones, floraforms, and more.  - It's a fun 3d platformer with a little challenge built into it.   Sorry the gaame also has negatives :( Negatives...  - Game lags even if you have a good computer, especially when falling.  - Sometimes floraform seeds dont grow even when touchng ground/water. And yes I know certain floraforms grow on certain grounds.  - This is a minor one. Sometimes you drown to quickly.  - Sometimes it can be hard to find the challenges just because they dont have a radar. I know you can use the sattelite thing to find them. It was just really hard to find the last one for me. Maybe next game you can choose what to radar?  Ok thats it, hope you enjoyed my thoughts about the game. Also don't think I dislike the game because I don't i loved it... Also developers if you see this review please take note of it, use the notes that I gave you.

Amazing game. 100% worth the 10 dollars it takes to buy the full game, as it is a through and through fantastic experience.  the controls are a bit unwieldy, but it adds to the experience. overall, the game is beautifully designed, relaxing to play, and fun to explore. grow up, along with Grow home, are definately in my list of the top games i've played of all time.  you will enjoy this game if you like physics based games, exploration games, zen games, and it's a safe bet if you're looking for something different to play, too.

This is a better game than the already excellent Grow Home but its still very short, the main goal can be achieved in about 4 hours without working too hard. From other reviews I had thought this was a much larger game, not just a little bigger.  Its not as reliant on the carpal tunnel inducing climbing mechanic as Grow Home, you quickly get better modes of movement and that is very welcome. But you do get overpowered very fast and really don't need to make use of the cool plants or your ability to grow those plants.  Where it falls down is the POD challenges which are not necessary and until you have all your powerups many are impossilbe. They also feel like tacked on typical platformer crap, got bored of them after doing 5 and stopped. Also once you build the ship there isn't any reason to keep exploring except to get more crystals, but you are already powered up and the goal is done so that is just tedious.  The necessary parts of the game are a lot of fun and feel very unique, its a shame they tacked on the tedious bits just to make the game feel bigger or longer when they should have just made the main quest longer.  Still a lot of fun for 5 bucks at sale time.
